name: ORGANIZATIONS

description: Precise details of the initiation rites are a mystery most never seek to learn. In addition to an initiation fee of 300 gp and dues of 60 gp per semester, members must animate or create at least one corporeal undead each semester. The loathsome creation is turned over to the «dead pool» of rotting manual labor that services the academy.
name: Membership

description: Members are schooled in ever-fouler rituals designed to summon and control animated corpses. Such study is not without risk—the students with the lowest marks in each class give up their immortal souls to their infernal teachers. An aspiring student of evil can pick up any of a variety of prestige classes here, including the blackguard and the assassin. This is the ultimate training ground for the pale master and the true necro- mancer (see Chapter 3: Prestige Classes).
name: Benefits

description: The leadership of the Bleak Academy is attributed to fiends, though powerful pale masters and necro- mancers also hold high office. Names of actual teachers and regents are hard to pin down, though, since most who repeat stories of the Bleak Academy are later found slain in creative and terrible ways—if they are found at all.
name: Leadership

description: Neither initiation fee nor annual dues Membership: There exists an initiation fee of 300gp are required, but members must take contracts assigned and annual dues of 60 gp. Members must also pass yearly by the guild leadership. examination to retain their standing.
name: Membership
